title: When will people learn, playing the same champion over and over doesn' make you better at them......
body:
I dream of a day that people will learn that playing the same champ over and over doesn't make you better at them -_-. Say you played {{champion:24}}  or {{champion:133}} in this case, and you have fed with that champ for 5 games in a row. A little message from Riot support should pop up saying "Hey!, need some help?. Looks like you have recently fed (*number of games) with that champ now and fkd them up for your team aswell. We have now blocked {{champion:133}} for (*number of days / hours) so you can get to try a new champ and try find one that will work for you :)"

P.s.......this is only a few of her {{champion:133}} games, the rest is too much

replies.body:
While I agree they shouldn't be learning a champion in ranked, you seem to have a fundamental misunderstanding of how learning works.

> playing the same champion over and over doesn't make you better at them......

That's exactly how you get better at a champion. Practise. Maybe a break would be recommended every now and again, but I sure as hell didn't get to be a decent Nami by NOT playing her.

Hahahaha i actually cant take it: "The best way to get good at a champion is not to practice them!" hahaha wtf? xD

Theres this thing called 'Logic' which you obviously lack.
If they want to play quinn let them play quinn. Sure ranked is not the way to learn a champ but adding in a system that blocks a champ is not ever going to happen.

So this is a post about how you got a teammate who feeds in your ranked game then realised they feed often?

When the only champ you play is singed?

So you can't really act like you know how to master multiple champs you just know one.
